page.title: 14Local Endon History.
page.content: In Saxon times Endon belonged to a chieftain named Dunning and it was in the Kingdom of Mercia. In the original Domesday Book of 1086, Endon is called Enedun. (Heandun is the Anglo-Saxon for "high hill"). It was described as wasteland.In the reign of Henry 111,the village belonged to the Audley family and was part of the Manor of Horton. A manor house was built at the bottom of Park Lane but nothing is left now except the remains of the moat. The name Stanley is derived from Stonelegh, meaning "stony ground." In 1596, Sir Roland Stanley was Lord of the Manor.
